description: This series is focused on CompTIA’s Security+ certifications. Security+ is a vendor-neutral certification that is recognized worldwide as a benchmark for information system security best practices. The series is intended for aspiring IT security professionals that have finished their training and want an accelerated version of the SY0-501 series. It is recommended that candidates used this content to round off their training prior to sitting for the SY0-501 exam.
descriptionMD: This series is focused on CompTIA’s Security+ certifications. Security+ is a vendor-neutral certification that is recognized worldwide as a benchmark for information system security best practices. It is recommended that candidates used this content to round off their training prior to sitting for the SY0-501 exam.
name: CompTIA Accelerated Security+ 2017
subtitle: Vendor-neutral IT Security

episodes.description: This series is focused on CompTIA’s Security+ certifications. Security+ is a vendor-neutral certification that is recognized worldwide as a benchmark for information system security best practices. The series is intended for aspiring IT security professionals that have finished their training and want an accelerated version of the SY0-501 series. It is recommended that candidates used this content to round off their training prior to sitting for the SY0-501 exam.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.784
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.784 --> 00:00:10.233
In this series we're gonna be looking
an accelerated version of CompTIA's vendor

3
00:00:10.233 --> 00:00:13.000
neutral certification
exam known as Security+.

4
00:00:13.000 --> 00:00:16.290
We're gonna be talking about,
well, what is Security+?

5
00:00:16.290 --> 00:00:20.390
So that you'll be a little bit more
prepared when it comes to diving into this

6
00:00:20.390 --> 00:00:21.270
series.

7
00:00:21.270 --> 00:00:24.290
We'll also talk about who this
course is for, as well as

8
00:00:24.290 --> 00:00:27.190
what are some of the things that we can
expect to see throughout this course.

9
00:00:27.190 --> 00:00:30.140
And then finally before
you sit the hot seat and

10
00:00:30.140 --> 00:00:33.860
take your certification exam we wanna give
you a little bit of information about

11
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:36.760
the structure of that exam and
some of the things that you can expect.

12
00:00:36.760 --> 00:00:40.770
So you'll be more prepared to not
only take the certification but

13
00:00:40.770 --> 00:00:41.720
as well as pass it.

14
00:00:41.720 --> 00:00:46.120
So let's go ahead and talk a little
bit about What is CompTIA Security+?

15
00:00:46.120 --> 00:00:47.540
Well, it's actually a benchmark for

16
00:00:47.540 --> 00:00:51.770
security's best practices and
IT security systems, right.

17
00:00:51.770 --> 00:00:57.099
It is also recognized as
a international certification.

18
00:00:57.099 --> 00:01:02.230
It has ISO 17024 accreditation to it.

19
00:01:02.230 --> 00:01:06.720
It's also compliant with the Federal
Information Safety Management Act as well

20
00:01:06.720 --> 00:01:09.950
as well as being recognized
by Department of Defense.

21
00:01:09.950 --> 00:01:14.150
It is a world wide accreditation that
means if you take your certification exam

22
00:01:14.150 --> 00:01:17.320
here in let's say the United States,

23
00:01:17.320 --> 00:01:22.830
it'll be recognized even if you travel
to other countries and then vice versa.

24
00:01:22.830 --> 00:01:26.300
Now, who is this accelerated
Security+ certification for?

25
00:01:26.300 --> 00:01:29.650
Well, this is for
candidates that require certification.

26
00:01:29.650 --> 00:01:32.980
The other thing to keep in mind is
that in the accelerated version,

27
00:01:32.980 --> 00:01:35.950
there are some assumed knowledge.

28
00:01:35.950 --> 00:01:40.400
The candidates will be required to
understand the basic concepts of securing

29
00:01:40.400 --> 00:01:45.220
information systems as well as the
candidates who are ready to take the exam.

30
00:01:45.220 --> 00:01:48.830
So if you want just some
of that last minute,

31
00:01:48.830 --> 00:01:52.560
just rocket rush of information to help
round off your training before you

32
00:01:52.560 --> 00:01:55.490
set the certification exam,
then this series is for you.

33
00:01:55.490 --> 00:01:58.930
Now what are some of the things that
we could see that will be covered

34
00:01:58.930 --> 00:02:00.370
inside of Security+?

35
00:02:00.370 --> 00:02:04.750
Well, we're gonna cover the objectives for
SY0-501,

36
00:02:04.750 --> 00:02:09.600
that is the current exam objectives for
Security+.

37
00:02:09.600 --> 00:02:12.310
We'll be looking at some of
the fundamental security concepts

38
00:02:12.310 --> 00:02:15.120
as well as the principles for
risk management.

39
00:02:15.120 --> 00:02:17.610
We'll also be looking at things like well,
host based and

40
00:02:17.610 --> 00:02:19.760
network based security techniques.

41
00:02:19.760 --> 00:02:23.650
We'll be looking at things like
compliance and operational standards.

42
00:02:23.650 --> 00:02:26.000
As well as some other things like for
instance,

43
00:02:26.000 --> 00:02:29.450
we'll be looking at threats
vulnerabilities and attacks.

44
00:02:29.450 --> 00:02:34.140
We'll be looking at things like technology
and some of the tools that you will be

45
00:02:34.140 --> 00:02:38.170
utilizing as you make your
way into IT security.

46
00:02:38.170 --> 00:02:40.310
We'll also be looking at
secure architecture and

47
00:02:40.310 --> 00:02:45.320
secure design followed by things
like identity access and management.

48
00:02:45.320 --> 00:02:50.330
We'll also be looking at risk management
as well as cryptology, cryptography,

49
00:02:50.330 --> 00:02:54.080
excuse me, and
the public key infrastructure.

50
00:02:54.080 --> 00:02:57.690
Now, the last thing we kind
of want to talk about here is

51
00:02:57.690 --> 00:02:59.360
what are some of the exam details?

52
00:02:59.360 --> 00:03:02.360
We don't want you to get in the exam
booth and not know what to expect,

53
00:03:02.360 --> 00:03:07.380
so keep in mind that the exam format is
going to be 90 minutes and 90 questions.

54
00:03:07.380 --> 00:03:11.310
It is a multiple choice,
performance based exam.

55
00:03:11.310 --> 00:03:15.600
Now, multiple choice means that you're
gonna have more than one choice.

56
00:03:15.600 --> 00:03:17.340
It could be multiple answers as well,

57
00:03:17.340 --> 00:03:20.760
meaning more than one answer for
a single question.

58
00:03:20.760 --> 00:03:22.860
Performance based, think of simulations.

59
00:03:22.860 --> 00:03:25.750
That means you might get a couple
simulations as well that you

60
00:03:25.750 --> 00:03:29.000
need to perform some kind of action,
whether it be a drag and

61
00:03:29.000 --> 00:03:33.940
drop or a simulation Inside of
some kind of security appliance.

62
00:03:33.940 --> 00:03:36.340
Passing score is going to be 750.

63
00:03:36.340 --> 00:03:41.353
750 and
that score range is from 100 to 900.

64
00:03:41.353 --> 00:03:45.540
Now in US dollars,
the exam currently costs $320.

65
00:03:45.540 --> 00:03:49.820
It is recommended that you have CompTIA's
Net+ certification under your belt and

66
00:03:49.820 --> 00:03:52.500
two years of IT administration experience.

67
00:03:52.500 --> 00:03:54.290
Keep in mind that it's not a requirement,

68
00:03:54.290 --> 00:03:58.250
it's not a prerequisite that you must
have these to take the Security+ exam.

69
00:03:58.250 --> 00:04:01.530
But it is recommended so
that you have some of the experience.

70
00:04:01.530 --> 00:04:06.301
And if that is what you are getting into,
wanting to get certified

71
00:04:06.301 --> 00:04:11.094
here then the accelerated
CompTIA Security+ series is for you.

72
00:04:11.094 --> 00:04:16.163
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes analyze indicators of compromise and determine types of malware used by attackers. Specific topics covered here includes: Viruses, Crypto-Malware, Ransomware, Worms, Spyware, Bots, Trojans, Logic Bombs, Backdoors, Keyloggers, Antivirus, Advanced malware tools, Removable media controls, Threat actors, and Using Open-Source Intelligence.
episodes.title: Determining Types of Malware

episodes.description: Wes and Cherokee explain the relationship yet differences of vulnerability scanning versus penetration testing. Wes stresses the importance of identifying the vulnerabilities with intrusive or by non intrusive means. They also discuss different types of penetration tests such as white, gray and black box testing.
episodes.title: Vulnerability Scanning and Pen Testing

episodes.description: In this show, Wes and Cherokee take a look at the impact various vulnerabilities can cause. There is no shortage of possibilities  when you examine the potential outcome of attacks. Tune in to learn about everything from race conditions to DLL injection attacks!
episodes.title: Impact of Various Vulnerabilities

episodes.description: In this show, Wes and Cherokee begin explaining the numerous types of devices that can provide security. They look at  firewalls,  NIDPs/NIPs, routers, switches, Proxies ,load balances, and wireless configurations that can increase overall security.
episodes.title: Supporting Organizational Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Wes continue to examine concepts to improve organizational  security. The list is long  but covers concepts like SIEMs, DLP, NAC, mail gateways, SSL decryptors, HSMs and more!
episodes.title: Supporting Organizational Security Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Wes explain security posture assessment. They discuss several tools and concepts that support how one may implement and support an organizations security posture. They cover several vulnerability scanners, data sanitation tools, stegangraphy tools, honeypot solutions and more!
episodes.title: Security Posture Assessment

episodes.description: In this show, Wes and Cherokee discuss concepts surrounding mobile device security. Wes outlines common connection methods followed by management options. With the popularity of mobile devices manufacturing companies are integrating security from the initial design. They suggest different methods to enforce security as well as monitoring in addition to, various deployment models.
episodes.title: Deploy Mobile Security

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Wes stress the importance of not only knowing what secure protocols are but rather one should also understand why they should not use the insecure counterpart. They also mention that in addition to understanding these protocols it is very important to be able to recognize the port numbers associated with these protocols for proper configuration and network analysis.
episodes.title: Implement Secure Protocols

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Wes explain and show where one can find best practices, guides, and configurations suggestions. Weather your concern may be regulatory, non-regulatory, national, international or industry standard one should always research their particular situation. Wes references defense in depth by reminding of several control types to include in the overall security policy.
episodes.title: Best Practices, Guides and Configuration

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Wes discus how designing a secure network from the ground up can provide a secure advantage.  They explain secure network architecture designs such as DMZs, network segmentation, wireless configurations, honeynets and more!
episodes.title: Secure Network Architecture Concepts

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Wes explain a couple variations of a deployment lifecycles. They look at waterfall versus agile methodologies.  Next, Wes explains Secure DevOp options, version control and change management, provisioning and de-provisioning, secure coding techniques, code quality and testing and more!
episodes.title: App Development and Deployment

episodes.description: Wes and Zach summarize cloud and virtualization concepts including what is a hypervisor & the various types, VM sprawl avoidance, VM escape protection, cloud storage, cloud deployment models, on premise vs. hosted cloud, VDI/VDE, cloud access security broker, RAID, difference between persistence vs. non-persistence, and much more.
episodes.title: Cloud and Virtualization Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Cherokee take a look at ways to authenticate such as LDAP, Kerberos, CHAP, PAP, MSCHAP, SAML, OpenID Connect and more. They also take a look at multifactor concepts followed by federated trust relationships.
episodes.title: Identity and Access Services

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Wes begin the discussion by explaining different access control models. They look at models such as MAC, DAC, ABAC, and two varieties of RBAC. They also cover physical, biometric and token based options.
episodes.title: IAM Controls

episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss common account management practices including types of accounts, general concepts, recertification, account maintenance, group based policies, location based policies, account enforcement, and procedures to insure policy enforcement.
episodes.title: Account Management Practices

episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover the importance of policies, plans, and proceedures related to organizational security including agreement types, personnel management, role based awareness training, types of users, importance of the NDA, off boarding & on boarding, continuing education, acceptable use policies, rules of behavior, exit interview, and adverse actions.
episodes.title: Policies, Plans and Procedures

episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss what risk management processes & concepts are, types of threats, what are various forms of risk assessment, difference between quantitative and qualitative risk assessments, testing types looking at penetration & vulnerability, risk response techniques, what is BIA, mission essential functions, MTBF, MTTR, and more.
episodes.title: Risk Management Processes and BIA

episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss incident response process including the procedures to follow, incident types & category definitions, and incident response plan. Forensics process and procedures include preservation, order of volatility, chain of custody, legal hold, data acquisition, capturing system images, network traffic & logs, capture video, record time offset, taking hashes, screenshots, and witness interviews. Recovery including strategic intelligence/counterintelligence is also covered.
episodes.title: IRP and Basic Forensics

episodes.description: Wes and Zach go over types of recovery sites available for disaster recovery & business continuity, order of restoration, backup concepts, geographic considerations, data sovereignty, and what is the order of continuity of operation planning.
episodes.title: Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity

episodes.description: Wes and Zach talk over the process and procedures of data security and and privacy practices looking at data destruction and media sanitization, the labeling and handling of data & data sensitivity, definitions of PII & PHI, data retention, sanitation tools, legal and compliance measures, plus data states.
episodes.title: Data Security and Privacy Practices

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain cryptography algorithms and their basic characteristics. Specific topics covered includes: Symmetric algorithms (AES, DES, 3DES, RC4, Blowfish), Cipher modes, Asymmetric algorithms (RSA, DSA, Diffie-Hellman, PGP), Digital Signatures, Steganography, Hashing algorithms, Key stretching, Session Keys, Key strength, Salting, and Obfuscation.
episodes.title: Cryptography Algorithms Basics

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Wes discuss cryptographic and authentic protocols as well as the underpinning technologies that may present vulnerabilities. Wireless transmission has no shortage of possible attacks. Tune in now to learn the various attacks and tools attackers may use to execute these attacks.
episodes.title: Wireless Security

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Wes delve into Public Key Infrastructure. They cover the required components to support the various ways certificates can be used.  They also cover the details including certificate formats and how one should exercise good key management.
episodes.title: Public Key Infrastructure
